column1: '''Vincent Ferré''' (born [[23 October]] [[1974]]) is a French [[J.R.R. Tolkien
column2: Tolkien]] scholar, lecturer and translator. He has written numerous books on the subject of Tolkien, contributed articles to the ''[[Hither Shore (journal)
column3: Hither Shore]]'' and the [[Tolkien Estate]], and runs his own dedicated Tolkien website [http://www.pourtolkien.fr/ Pour Tolkien]. Professionally, he is a Professor of General and Comparative Literature at the [[wikipedia:Paris 12 Val de Marne University

column1: * [[2001]]: ''[[Tolkien: sur les rivages de la Terre du Milieu]]''
** "Traduire Tolkien en français: On the Translation of J.R.R. Tolkien's Works into French and their Reception in France" (with Daniel Lauzon and David Riggs)
** "The Rout of the King: Tolkien's Readings on Arthurian Kingship – Farmer Giles of Ham and The Homecoming of Beorhtnoth"
** "The Rout of the King: Tolkien's Readings on Arthurian Kingship"
* [[2008]]: ''[[The Ring Goes Ever On: Proceedings of the Tolkien 2005 Conference]]''
** "Tolkien, the author and the critic: Beowulf, Sir Gawain and the Green Knight, The Homecoming of Beorhtnoth and The Lord of the Rings"
** "[http://www.tolkienestate.com/en/learning/specific-works/leaf-by-niggle-hidden-nucleus.html Leaf by Niggle: The Hidden Nucleus]"
** "[http://www.tolkienestate.com/en/learning/specific-works/the-lord-of-the-rings-an-adventure-story.html Is The Lord of the Rings an Adventure Story?]"
